com.skillstorm.training

Class GroupWork

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.skillstorm.training.GroupWork

  • public class GroupWork
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains utility methods for parsing URLs and file names.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getUserId

        public static int getUserId(java.lang.String url)
        Finds the url path variable /user/{id} accounting for further subpaths like https://www.skillstorm.store.com/user/12345/cart_id/5?checkout=false
        Parameters:
        url - an absolute URL that contains the userid such as https://www.skillstorm.store.com/user/12345
        Returns:
        an int containing the users id number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the url is null, empty, or not a valid url

      • getQueryParameterValue

        public static java.lang.String getQueryParameterValue(java.lang.String url,
                                                      java.lang.String key)
        Extracts the value of a url's query parameter given a url. Note: A url can contain a list of key-value pairs in the format https://www.domain.com/page?key1=value1&key2=value2 Assumes that there is only one ? in the url String and the key-value pairs are always separated by &. A key might be present but not have a value such as in: https://www.domain.com/page?key1=&key2=value2 in which case an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        url - a url containing query parameters
        key - the name of the url's query parameter to grab the value from
        Returns:
        String containing the value or null if the key is not present.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the url or key are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the url is not a url, the key is empty, or the key contains an illegal character in the set of characters ";", "/", "?", ":", "@", "&", "=", "+", ",", and "$"

      • isCSV

        public static boolean isCSV(java.lang.String filepath)
        Checks if the given filepath is a .csv file. Accounting for the case where the file name includes .csv but the actual file extension is something else like "mydata.csv.txt"
        Parameters:
        filepath - an absolute or relative filepath
        Returns:
        true if the filepath ends in .csv
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the filepath is null, empty, or does not contain a file extension
